intro: Quintinia acutifolia var. lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved quintinia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It features lanceolate leaves that are typically 5–10 cm long and have a smooth, glossy surface. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during the autumn season. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
